ygData.subject: RE: Re: Psalm of Warmth
ygData.msgSnippet: ... By the way, I put round in quotes because it s a completely arbitrary length of time.  It could be per second, per hour, per 3 seconds, whatever.  Just
ygData.messageBody:
On Fri, 19 Nov 1999, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
> than me, and our EQ team here at work was arguing over it. I checked my
> equation when I got home and it was a bit different than John's, but only
> because I used average damage per hit and hit% while he used average damage
> per round and hits per round. Worked out the same after converting. Still,

By the way, I put "round" in quotes because it's a completely
arbitrary length of time. It could be per second, per hour,
per 3 seconds, whatever. Just pick a length of time you like
and insert it everywhere you see "round" for all the
calculations.

You do make a good point though - time is irrelevant in this
case (unlike with Bellow, where time determined how many
Bellows you could get in). Chain reduces damage by 30%
regardless of time, Psalm applies damage per hit, regardless
of time. So you can do this comparison based entirely on
damage/hit and hit%.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
